description: A scientist and single mother living in California in the 1960s becomes a star on a TV cooking show.
Nine years after being cast out, a young woman returns to reclaim her place in her family and comes into her own as a bootlegger.
In a homage to Louisa May Alcott’s “Little Women,” a young man’s dark past resurfaces as he gets to know the family of his college sweetheart.
The lives of a lemon grower, a young lawyer, a new mother and a reclusive goatherd collide in Sicily during the rise of the Mafia.
Two friends find their partnership challenged in the world of video game design.
A man imprisoned for murdering his 3-year-old son becomes convinced his son is still alive and plans an escape.
A botched field operation and a terrorist plot endanger Amy Cornwall and her family.
Three women navigate their roles in a well-to-do family living in Brooklyn Heights.
A reimagining of Charles Dickens’s “David Copperfield” set in the mountains of southern Appalachia.
A widow working the night shift at the Sowell Bay Aquarium is aided in solving a mystery by a giant Pacific octopus living there.
Drastic changes and a pair of six-inch high Christian Louboutin red crocodile shoes shake up the lives of two women.
The 23rd book in the Joe Pickett series. Joe and Nate might be on opposite sides for the first time.
A collection of poems by the author of “How the Word Is Passed.”

bookTitle: I HAVE SOME QUESTIONS FOR YOU
description: A film professor and podcaster is invited back to teach a course at the boarding school where her roommate was murdered.

bookAuthor: Jodi Picoult and Jennifer Finney Boylan
description: After returning to her hometown, Olivia McAfee’s son gets accused of killing his crush.
In 1947, Elinor White, a former wartime operative, must face an organized crime gang in London.
The 29th book in the Anita Blake, Vampire Hunter series. Anita and Jean-Claude get engaged and an ancient evil comes to St. Louis.
A divorced mother of twins and chief executive of a luxury department store goes against a wealthy investor looking to take it over.
A prequel to “The Priory of the Orange Tree.” When the Dreadmount erupts, several women must protect humankind.
The 32nd book in the Commissario Brunetti series. Brunetti looks into the murder of an undocumented Sri Lankan immigrant.
In 1873, a woman seeking answers about her sister’s death accompanies a spiritualist to look into a murder.
The stories of three women living in three different eras.
Aiding an Imperial deserter could put Cal Kestis and his crew in the path of the Inquisitor known as the Fifth Brother.
A high school kid inherits a shed that is a portal to another world where good and evil are at war.
A former pirate on the Indian Ocean is asked to retrieve her comrade’s kidnapped daughter.
Two childhood friends follow in their fathers’ footsteps, which puts them on opposite sides of the law.
Nora Seed finds a library beyond the edge of the universe that contains books with multiple possibilities of the lives one could have lived.
Seven years after witnessing her best friend drop dead, Maya returns to her Berkshires hometown to piece together what happened.
At the McMasters Conservatory for the Applied Arts, students learn how to “delete” someone.
The 12th book in the Gray Man series. Stolen records, the Russian mafia and the C.I.A. complicate things for Court Gentry and his lover.
The 17th book in the Cotton Malone series. Malone and Daniels battle adversaries in Bavaria.
An aspiring writer goes on a writing retreat that might have life-changing or life-ending outcomes.
The 56th book of the In Death series. Eve Dallas investigates the mysterious death of a well-loved star of stage and screen.
After her father is murdered, Jenny Wolf becomes the head of a powerful family in California.
Complications involving love, family and higher education impact the lives of two women living in the 1950s.
The eighth book in the Orphan X series. Evan Smoak must choose between his principles or his life.
After a battle in 14th-century southern India, a girl named Pampa Kampana becomes a vessel for a goddess and spends 250 years seeking to give women equal agency in a patriarchal world.
The 38th book in the Alex Delaware series. Alex and Milo investigate the murder of a wealthy photographer.
Maddie, the daughter of an overbearing mother recently returned from Ghana and a father suffering from Parkinson’s, begins to build a life for herself in London.
Questions surrounding the case of a missing woman, which have weighed on Aaron Falk for the past year, emerge at a gathering in the southern Australian wine country.

bookTitle: HOW TO SELL A HAUNTED HOUSE
description: After her parents die, Louise encounters more than she expected in dealing with the family home.
The story of a racehorse, an enslaved groom and an itinerant painter reverberates in three different eras.
The third book in the Finlay Donovan series. A mob boss, a contract killer and parenthood complicate things for Finlay and Vero.
The second book in the Alex Stern series. Alex risks her future at Lethe and Yale to get Darlington out of purgatory.
The 21st book in the Pendergast series. Constance Greene travels back in time to prevent the deaths of her siblings.

bookTitle: THE LAST THING HE TOLD ME
description: Hannah Hall discovers truths about her missing husband and bonds with his daughter from a previous relationship.
In Los Angeles in 1981, a prep school senior becomes obsessed with a new student at the same time he and his circle of friends are taunted by a serial killer.
Charles Vincent meets someone who ignites his passion and must decide whether to walk away from his perfect-from-the-outside life.
Nina Hayes searches for her missing husband while a couple close to her cover their tracks.
In 1828, Robin Swift studies at Oxford University’s Royal Institute of Translation and faces a choice when Britain pursues a war with China.
Competing narratives about a wealthy New York couple have new revelations over the course of a century.
A servant, an heir and a journalist are caught up in a complicated series of events involving romance and corruption in India.
The 18th book in the Chief Inspector Gamache series. When an attic room that was sealed off 160 years ago is opened, an old enemy returns.
Two women visit an Italian villa where events in the 1970s sparked a horror novel, a platinum album and a murder.
Musicians from different backgrounds are attracted to each other and a mother flees with her son from an abusive husband.
Lowen Ashleigh is hired by the husband of an injured writer to complete her popular series and uncovers a horrifying truth.
Detective Alex Cross and the true-crime author Thomas Tull search for a serial killer known as the Family Man.
In 1550s Florence, the future of the third daughter of the grand duke seems uncertain after she is thrust into a marriage.
The 29th book in the Stephanie Plum series. The man who abducted the office manager at Vinnie's Bail Bonds demands a mysterious coin in exchange for her.
The 22nd book in the Jack Ryan series. Ryan goes behind the Berlin Wall in 1985 to investigate an East German defector.
The 27th book in the Jack Reacher series. Reacher goes after a killer but is unaware of the bigger implications.
Ballard and Bosch bury old resentments as they go after two killers.
A companion volume to McCarthy's recent novel "The Passenger." A doctoral candidate diagnosed with paranoid schizophrenia contemplates the nature of madness.
The third book in the Dragon Heart Legacy series. Breen Siobhan Kelly confronts darkness during her first Christmas in both Talamh and Ireland.
After tragedy strikes, six adult children return to the family home without their parents for the first time.
Twelve-year-old Bird Gardner goes on a quest to find his mother, a Chinese American poet whose work he was taught to disavow.
In 1967, the joy of the holiday season seems out of reach to a boy whose brother died in the Vietnam War and father lost his job.
The seventh book in the Mistborn series. The fate of millions depends on a decision by the frontier lawman turned big-city senator Waxillium Ladrian.
The seventh book in the Memory Man series. Decker works with a new partner to investigate a double homicide.
The first of a two-volume story. Bobby Western discovers things have gone missing from a jet in an underwater crash site, including the 10th passenger.
A woman assigned to the Met Cloisters discovers a 15th-century deck of tarot cards that might help predict the future.
The 19th book in the Elvis Cole and Joe Pike series. A search for a missing podcaster involves corrupt politicians and business cartels.
The 26th book in the Kay Scarpetta series. Scarpetta becomes a star witness in a televised murder trial and the judge’s sister is found dead.
The second book in the Atlas series. The Society of Alexandrians is headed by someone intent on changing life as we know it.
The eighth book in the John Corey series. When a former lover offers him a job, Corey comes out of forced retirement to track a serial killer.
The 32nd book in the Prey series. Virgil Flowers and Lucas Davenport go after a group of vigilante killers.
A collection of nine short stories by the author of “Lincoln in the Bardo,” which won the Man Booker Prize.
The son of a competitive slalom skier returns to the hotel in Aspen where he was conceived and encounters some ghosts.
A pastor and a bartender discover love when they switch jobs during the holidays.
The third book in the Beartown series. Rivalries between two hockey-obsessed towns escalate into violence off the ice.
A staged friendship between the son of the president and his rival, the Prince of Wales, evolves into a secret and potentially dangerous romance.
Beginning at age 12, Iris Cooper endures a number of hardships in hopes of finding success as a singer.
The 63rd book in the Stone Barrington series. Further adventures begin when a dead man turns up on Stone’s doorstep.
President Keegan Barrett’s power grab tests the loyalties of two C.I.A. agents.
A journalist who returns to her hometown vows to find a missing girl and solve a 20-year-old cold case.
A collection of nine stories set during summers in Nantucket.
The sixth book in the Cassie Dewell series. Cassie works two cases involving buried treasure and a con man.
The 21st book in the Mitch Rapp series. President Cook, a team of assassins and a killer known as Legion confront Rapp on different fronts.
A forensic pathologist is on the trail of a serial killer in the Louisiana bayou.
In 1928, an orphan and her family create a theater from the rib cage of a whale, which should be the property of the king.
The third book in the Scholomance series. Life after graduation turns out to be dangerous.
A private investigator named Pinky helps an attorney try to clear a female police chief of sexual misconduct charges made by three male officers.
In the nightlife world of 1926 London, Nellie Coker seeks to advance her six children.
As the pandemic starts, Lucy Barton and her ex-husband go to a small town in Maine, where they confront their shared history.
A tennis player comes out of retirement and trains with her father to defend her record.
The third book in the Thursday Murder Club series. A decade-old cold case and a new foe spark the latest adventure.
A follow-up to the Pulitzer Prize-winning novel “Less,” in which Arthur Less goes on a road trip across America.
When his ex-girlfriend turns up dead in his office building, an entry-level investment analyst delves into the halls of economic power.
The 55th book of the In Death series. Eve Dallas is reminded of her past as she investigates a possible sex trafficking ring.
Six months after waking up in a stranger’s body, Nona is torn between living an ordinary life or saving those around her from strange forces.
The 16th book in the Oregon Files series. A criminal syndicate has a torpedo that could obliterate entire cities.
Roland Baines looks back at his personal regrets and the historical upheavals in his lifetime.
The 18th book in the Longmire series. Sheriff Longmire finds an adversary in himself.
Four women who spent 40 years working as assassins have targets on their backs as they enter retirement.
The sixth book in the Cormoran Strike series. When a cartoonist is murdered, Cormoran and Robin go after a mysterious online figure known as Anomie.
When she takes over her deceased mother’s apartment, Zoey has strange encounters with her new neighbors.
The 10th book in the Vera Stanhope series. A member of a group of friends is found hanged after being fired because of potential misconduct.
